checkuser-summary:
This tool scans recent changes to retrieve the IP addresses used by a user or show the edit/user data for an IP address.
Users and edits by a client IP address can be retrieved via XFF headers by appending the IP address with "/xff". IPv4 (CIDR $1-32) and IPv6 (CIDR $2-128) are supported.
No more than $3 edits will be returned for performance reasons.
Use this in accordance with policy.
checkuser-desc: Grants users with the appropriate permission the ability to check users' IP addresses and other information
right-checkuser: Check users' IP addresses and other information
right-checkuser-temporary-account: View IP addresses used by temporary accounts
right-checkuser-temporary-account-no-pre: View IP addresses used by temporary accounts without needing to turn on the preference
right-checkuser-temporary-account-log: View the log of access to temporary account IP addresses
right-checkuser-temporary-account-auto-r: Automatically reveal IP addresses used by temporary accounts
grant-checkuser-temporary-account: Access checkuser data for temporary accounts
action-checkuser: check users' IP addresses and other information
action-checkuser-temporary-account: view IP addresses used by temporary accounts
action-checkuser-temporary-account-no-pr: view IP addresses used by temporary accounts
action-checkuser-temporary-account-log: view the log of access to temporary account IP addresses
action-checkuser-temporary-account-auto-: automatically reveal IP addresses used by temporary accounts
checkuser-cidr-label: Find common range and affected IP addresses for a list of IP addresses
checkuser-range-outside-limit: The range $1 is outside the allowed limits.

No matches found.
Last edit was on $1 at $2.
checkuser-massblock-text-without-local-b: You do not have the rights needed to block users on this wiki. However, you can still use the checkboxes in the results above to select accounts and IPs you wish to either lock or globally block (depending on your access).
checkuser-massblock-text: Use the checkboxes in the results above to select accounts and IPs you wish to block. Then you can use the buttons below, which will open the {{#special:InvestigateBlock}} form with the targets input prefilled.

* Common block reasons
** Abusing multiple accounts
** Spamming links to external sites
** Vandalism

checkuser-initiator-nonexistent: The specified initiator does not exist.

logentry-checkuser-private-event-login-f: {{GENDER:$2|Failed}} to log in to {{SITENAME}} as $4 but had the correct password
logentry-checkuser-private-event-user-lo: Successfully {{GENDER:$2|logged out}} using the API or {{#special:logout}}
group-checkuser.css: /* CSS code placed here will affect checkusers only */
group-checkuser.js: /* JavaScript code placed here will be loaded for checkusers only */
checkuser-temporary-accounts-onboarding-: To protect user privacy, {{SITENAME}} is no longer publicly displaying the IP addresses of logged-out editors. Instead, logged-out editors will be given automatically generated usernames linked to [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Temporary_accounts temporary accounts], and their IP addresses will only be visible to trusted community members who need to see them to deal with vandalism and abusive behavior. When a temporary account is created for a logged-out editor, a cookie will be set in that editor’s browser. That temporary account will then be attributed to all subsequent edits, even if the IP address of that editor changes.
Image showing the temporary account user icon.

The [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Trust_and_Safety_Product/IP_Info IP Information] (IP Info) tool makes it easier for admins, vandal fighters and experienced users to access information about IP addresses without seeing the IP addresses themselves.

Users who meet the access requirements can enable IP Info in their preferences. Once enabled, the IP Info popup will be displayed next to temporary accounts and legacy IP addresses. IP information will also be displayed on the Contributions page.
Image showing the IPInfo tool in use to lookup information about a temporary account on a page, where the information icon has been clicked to show a popup.
Something went wrong. Please try again. The error message received was: $1
Revealing the IP addresses of temporary accounts

Admins, vandal fighters and experienced users can now choose to reveal the IP addresses associated with a temporary account. Once turned on, the "{{int:checkuser-tempaccount-reveal-ip-button-label}}" button will be displayed next to temporary accounts.

{{int:checkuser-temporary-accounts-onboarding-dialog-ip-reveal-step-content-base}}

Users who meet the access requirements may need to turn on IP reveal in their [[Special:Preferences#mw-prefsection-personal-checkuser-tempaccount|preferences]] or [[Special:GlobalPreferences#mw-prefsection-personal-checkuser-tempaccount|global preferences]].
You can manage the ability to see temporary account IP addresses in your [[Special:Preferences#mw-prefsection-personal-checkuser-tempaccount|preferences]].
You can manage the ability to see temporary account IP addresses in your [[Special:GlobalPreferences#mw-prefsection-personal-checkuser-tempaccount|global preferences]].

{{int:checkuser-temporary-accounts-onboarding-dialog-ip-reveal-postscript-text-with-global-preferences}} Automatic IP reveal mode is managed in the Tools menu using the "{{int:checkuser-ip-auto-reveal-link-sidebar}}" link, with options for different durations. The default duration is $1.

Image showing the IP reveal tool after a use, where the IP address associated with the temporary account is shown. The button pressed to see this is labelled with the text '{{int:checkuser-tempaccount-reveal-ip-button-label}}' and is shown next to temporary account username.
Turn on the "{{int:checkuser-tempaccount-reveal-ip-button-label}}" button, which will reveal IP addresses of temporary accounts on all wikis where you meet the access requirements.

Turn on "{{int:checkuser-ip-auto-reveal-link-sidebar}}" mode, which will automatically reveal the IP addresses of temporary accounts. Users should take care not to inadvertently disclose IP addresses to others.
IP Reveal has been enabled on the current wiki.
IP Reveal has been enabled globally on all wikis where you meet the access requirements.

checkuser-investigateblock-failure: No users were blocked. To override existing blocks, check: "{{int:checkuser-investigateblock-reblock-label}}". A block will not be overridden if the new block is identical to the existing block.

checkuser-investigateblock-notices-faile: Some notices could not be added to the user pages or user talk pages.
checkuser-investigateblock-warning-ips-a: You are about to block both accounts and IPs with the same reason at the same time after using CheckUser data. This may violate the privacy policy for the site. Are you sure you want to do this?
checkuser-investigateblock-warning-confi: If you are sure you really want to do it, please check the "{{int:checkuser-investigateblock-confirm-blocks-label}}" field at the bottom.
checkuser-investigateblock-warning-users: The number of users to be blocked exceeds the limit of $1. Only the first {{PLURAL:$1|user has|$1 users have}} been included in the users field.

checkuser-ip-auto-reveal-on-dialog-text: Turning on this feature will automatically reveal all temporary account IP addresses for a limited time. [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Trust_and_Safety_Product/Temporary_Accounts/Access_to_IP#Automatically_showing_IPs_for_temporary_accounts Learn more]
checkuser-ip-auto-reveal-off-dialog-text: For privacy reasons this feature will automatically turn off at the end of the duration. [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Trust_and_Safety_Product/Temporary_Accounts/Access_to_IP#Automatically_showing_IPs_for_temporary_accounts Learn more]
checkuser-ip-auto-reveal-off-dialog-erro: The duration cannot be set to more than $1
checkuser-tempaccount-enable-preference-: When using this tool you should ensure that you do so within policy.
checkuser-tempaccount-enable-preference: Turn on the ability to display IP addresses of temporary accounts

checkuser-tempaccount-reveal-ip-permissi: To view IP addresses for temporary accounts, please accept the agreement in [[Special:Preferences|your preferences]].
checkuser-tempaccount-reveal-blocked-mis: You were prevented from revealing temporary account IP addresses due to a block affecting your account, which is no longer in place. Please reload the page.
